poem:
Title: "Lament for Thames"

Thames Water roils,
in unrest and spoil.
Fruitful funds recede,
abandoning its need.

A cup, once filled,
now concerningly still.
Lo, the spectral spectre of lack -
a menace painted black.

Is it a destiny held in national hands?
Or a wasteland, bereft and vacant as sands?
What life— once abundant, now drained,
in the twilight of fortunes, unclaimed.
